author: Alex Brown
text:
The American Community Survey is an annual survey conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau which collects and reports information on demographic and economic information of U.S. households. The data collected in this survey helps inform how over $400 billion in federal and state funds are directed each year.
The U.S. House of Representatives recently voted to defund the American Community Survey. As noted in an opinion by former Michigan Governor John Engler (link below), this would deprive state and local governments of a vital tool for community planning and targeting distribution of funds where they are needed most.
Opinion: "It’s shortsighted for Congress to eliminate census data" - http://reut.rs/MdWpVr
Does your community use data reported by the American Community Survey? If you lost this resource how would it impact your planning process?
title: U.S. Census American Community Survey
